name: UFO: Extraterrestrials Gold
description: UFO: Extraterrestrials GOLD is a new GOLD edition which includes a number of changes and improvements giving a player a new look on the classic game: new maps, possibility to hire soldiers, globe UFO swarms and configurability.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 2000/XP/VistaProcessor: 1.5 Ghz ProcessorMemory: 256 MB RAMHard Drive: 2.6 GB of free spaceGraphics: 128 MB Video Card with DirectX 9.0c compatible driversSound: DirectX 9.0c compatibleDirectX®: 9.0c

reviews.review_text: This game feels like an attempt to improve the good old X-com series (Which franky I liked quite a lot). Honestly, I played it through only once and I found it quite enjoyable, but I believe this will mostly apply to people who loved the old series.  It sports the same old train-your-troops, go to turn based battles which makes this this genre unique, however I found the difficulty somewhat unbalanced at points (too easy or damn hard).  All in all, I recommend the game for fans to kill time until you go and play the newer xcom series.
Love it, one of the best xcom clone i have played and are still playing. bman mod wich is included in the game lets you costumize alot of aspects in the game to your own liking.  9 out of 10

I don't know much about the history of this game, but I think this is a more up to date version of the old X-Com UFO defense game. Immensely enjoyable with a lot of replay value. Noah, or Paul it was one of you who recommended the old original X-COM game to me and I'm glad you did. If you don't own this game already, you will enjoy it. Lots of fun.

I wasn't expecting anything spectacular, but this game felt like it was jury-rigged and half-finished. I don't get why it has so many positive reviews. It relies on an unofficial mod (which creates black-bordered arrows on the ground) and there's no story that I can see. The interface is also not even as user-friendly as, say, Xenonauts.
This is same as XCOM with better graphics and new features. Cool game.

I sat down to play this game at 9PM, and played for an hour. I got my butt kicked and learned a bit about what i did wrong. After about an hour, i looked at the clock and it was 3AM. I'm never touching this game ever again.  10/10
